intro: Simarouba versicolor var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf simarouba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds, and the tree can reach heights of up to 20 meters. Due to its ecological importance and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
